result.execSummary:
The defendant Hans Z. Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hans Z. Willis

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM case called. Defendant Hans Z. Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Hans Z. Willis.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement. Defendant waives right to have Judge Wickstrom in person and court accepts waiver. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads no contest to amended count 1: Disorderly Conduct (no repeater). Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders defendant to pay court costs and provide a DNA sample.

9:31 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hans Z. Willis not in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Hans Z. Willis. Attorney Robole states the Defendant is currently in custody and did not request he be brought over. No offer received yet.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

11:18 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hans Z. Willis appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Katherine Cook. 
Waives reading of the complaint. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7-13-22 AT 2:30 pm. Return to court: 8-8-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with Riverfront Park.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
